dct_description_sm: With “Page 62”(top left) and with longitude markings along bottom border west to east from 198 or 368 [sic] degrees. Apparently printed both with text on the page and alone.

Issued in his: Geography rectified: or, a Description of the World ..., 1693. Issued in: A Geographical dictionary; representing the present and ancient names of all the countries, provinces, remarkable cities, universities, ports, towns, mountains, seas, streights, fountains, and rivers of the whole World ... , Second edition ... together with several useful maps not in the former Edition, opposite p. [33] / by Edmund Bohun. -- London : Printed for Charles Brome, at the Gun, at the West-End of S. Pauls, 1691. (Checklist maps #97 and 98 are not included.)
California of Sanson's second model and with only P. Sr. F. Drake named. Title and cartographer’s name without cartouche (top left).
Barbara McCorkle; AshleyBaynton-Williams; Faupel’s Catalog 106(126); David M. Rumsey.
